intro: Noccaea platycarpa, commonly known as the broad-fruited honesty, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other well-known plants such as cabbages and mustards. The plant produces small, white flowers that bloom in late spring, followed by distinctive round, white seed pods. Its leaves are alternate, lobed, and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Noccaea platycarpa is often found in grassy areas and along roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils.
